channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-21272] Resuming Savepoint (rocks, scale down, rocks timers) end-to-end test' Fail
item.description:
https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=12893&view=logs&j=c88eea3b-64a0-564d-0031-9fdcd7b8abee&t=ff888d9b-cd34-53cc-d90f-3e446d355529

[FAIL] 'Resuming Savepoint (rocks, scale up, rocks timers) end-to-end test' failed after 0 minutes and 37 seconds! Test exited with exit code 0 but the logs contained errors, exceptions or non-empty .out files
item.summary: Resuming Savepoint (rocks, scale down, rocks timers) end-to-end test' Fail

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: maguowei, is this issue duplicated with FLINK-21217?
One is scale up. The other is scale down.  But I am not sure whether the two case have the same reason.

I extracted exceptions from the task executor logs:

java.util.concurrent.CancellationException: null
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.cancel(CompletableFuture.java:2276) ~[?:1.8.0_282]
        at org.apache.flink.runtime.state.StateUtil.discardStateFuture(StateUtil.java:77) ~[flink-dist_2.11-1.13-SNAPSHOT.jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.flink.streaming.api.operators.OperatorSnapshotFutures.lambda$cancel$0(OperatorSnapshotFutures.java:173) ~[flink-dist_2.11-1.13-SNAPSHOT.jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.flink.shaded.guava18.com.google.common.io.Closer.close(Closer.java:214) ~[flink-dist_2.11-1.13-SNAPSHOT.jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT]

        at org.apache.flink.streaming.runtime.tasks.mailbox.Mail.run(Mail.java:90) ~[flink-dist_2.11-1.13-SNAPSHOT.jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.flink.streaming.runtime.tasks.mailbox.MailboxProcessor.processMailsWhenDefaultActionUnavailable(MailboxProcessor.java:314) ~[flink-dist_2.11-1.13-SNAPSHOT.jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT]

        at org.apache.flink.streaming.runtime.tasks.StreamTask.lambda$notifyCheckpointOperation$13(StreamTask.java:1098) ~[flink-dist_2.11-1.13-SNAPSHOT.jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT]

        at org.apache.flink.streaming.runtime.tasks.mailbox.MailboxProcessor.processMailsWhenDefaultActionUnavailable(MailboxProcessor.java:314) [flink-dist_2.11-1.13-SNAPSHOT.jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.flink.streaming.runtime.tasks.mailbox.MailboxProcessor.processMail(MailboxProcessor.java:300) [flink-dist_2.11-1.13-SNAPSHOT.jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.flink.streaming.runtime.tasks.mailbox.MailboxProcessor.runMailboxLoop(MailboxProcessor.java:188) [flink-dist_2.11-1.13-SNAPSHOT.jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT]

I think it is caused by FLINK-19462. roman_khachatryan could you verify that?
I also checked https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-21217 and the exceptions are the same. I will mark the other issue as a duplicate.

I've looked in the logs and those two are duplicates. The problem in both is the same. Test didn't fail but logs were polluted with unexpected WARN message:

2021-02-04 01:54:41,832 WARN  org.apache.flink.streaming.runtime.tasks.AsyncCheckpointRunnable [] - Could not properly clean up the async checkpoint runnable.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: null
